result.execSummary:
The defendant Darnell Lamont Hudson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: - Court WITHHOLDS sentence; grants 31 days credit COURT STAYS the sentence.

miscConds.notes: - Court ADVISES the defendant he cannot possess firearms; further, defendant is advised he cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.

- Probation may be terminated by the agent after 12 months if defendant is complying with conditions of probation. 
- Mental health evaluation and comply with any recommended treatment and/or therapy. 
- Take all medications as prescribed. 
- Seek/Obtain stable housing
- AODA assessment and comply with any recommended treatment.

- Court sets Restitution at $0 (zero)
- Court waived any non-mandatory costs, fees, assessments or surcharges due to defendant's inability to pay. 
- Defendant to provide a biological specimen for DNA analysis and pay any mandatory costs, fees, assessments or surcharges (if not already don so) during the term of probation or extended supervision. 
- If confinement is served- DOC to collect monetary sums/amounts at a rate (to be determined by DOC) of prison funds.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Darnell Lamont Hudson

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Darnell Lamont Hudson in court, in custody.  Attorney Angel L Johnson in court for Darnell Lamont Hudson.  Attorney Dax Odom in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Sentencing proceeds.  Corrections made to the presentence investigation report. State has complied with victim notification.  Statements by the State, defense counsel and defendant. 

-  Court sets Restitution at $ 0  (zero)  

COURT ADVISES the defendant he cannot possess firearms; further, defendant is advised he cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.  Defendant was further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. 

Further, Court advises parties that the offense date of January 14 is reflected in the criminal complaint and the Information however there is data the court can view in the CCAP record that indicates the offense date of February 28.  The correct offense date is January 14 and should be reflected throughout the CCAP record.


Court WITHHOLDS sentence; grants  31  days credit 
COURT STAYS the sentence and places the defendant on probation for a period of 18  months.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-  Probation may be terminated by the agent after 12 months if defendant is complying with conditions of probation
-  Mental Health evaluation and comply with any recommended treatment and/or therapy
-  Take all medications as prescribed
-  AODA assessment and comply with any recommended treatment
-  Seek/Obtain stable housing
-  Court waives any non-mandatory costs, fees, assessments or surcharges due to defendant's inability to pay.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
-  Mental Health evaluation and comply with any recommended treatment and/or therapy
-  Take all medications as prescribed
-  AODA assessment and comply with any recommended treatment
-  Seek/Obtain stable housing
-  Court waives any non-mandatory costs, fees, assessments or surcharges due to defendant's inability to pay.

COURT ORDERS:
-  defendant to provide a biological specimen for DNA analysis and pay any mandatory costs, fees, assessments or surcharges (if not already done so) during the term of probation or extended supervision. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
if confinement is served - DOC to collect monetary sums/amounts at a rate (to be determined by DOC) of prison funds.

Appeal rights given.  Pretrial Incarceration Credit and Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.  Copies given to the defendant.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.

Defendant Darnell Lamont Hudson in court with Attorney Angel L Johnson.  Defendant Darnell Lamont Hudson in custody.  Dennis Murphy, appearing for Kelly Hedge, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  All parties appear in person.
Case recalled.

At the hour of 11:27 a.m. the jury returned and by their foreperson submitted the following verdicts to the Court:

"We, the jury, find the defendant, Darnell Hudson, NOT GUILTY of Theft from Person as charged in count one of the Information."

"We, the jury, find the defendant, Darnell Hudson, NOT GUILTY of Unauthorized Use of Personal Identifying Information as charged in count two of the Information."

"We, the jury, find the defendant, Darnell Hudson, GUILTY of Bail Jumping as charged in count three of the Information."

All verdict forms:

"Dated at Milwaukee, Wisconsin, this 5 day of May, 2022."  and signed by the foreperson

Court polls the jury
Jury panel released from service and out of the box at 11:30 a.m.
State's motion for judgment notwithstanding the verdicts
Defense motion for acquittal
Court orders a judgment of acquittal be entered as to Counts 1 and 2 and a judgment of conviction be entered as to Count 3.

As to Count 1 and 2 Court orders defendant released from all conditions of bail.

Kelly Hedge for State of Wisconsin present in court.  State requests PSI.  Defense requests PSI be prepared without a recommendation.
Court orders PSI be prepared without a recommendation.

Court will address bail as to Case# 22CF01089.

Court orders case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 28.

Defendant Darnell Lamont Hudson in court by video with Attorney Angel L Johnson who appears in person.  Defendant Darnell Lamont Hudson in custody.  Kelly Hedge appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Court took judicial notice of 21CF3525. Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD officer N. Lorum. Exhibits 1 & 2 offered by the State and received by the Court. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial. State withdraws exhibits #1 & #2.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 28.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 6, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Certified copy of Criminal Court Record as to Milwaukee County Case# 21CF03525 - received
Certified copy of bail form signed October 30, 2021
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.

Defendant Darnell Lamont Hudson in court with attorney Nathan Francis Opland-Dobs.  Defendant Darnell Lamont Hudson in custody.  Jon R Josephsen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Darnell Lamont Hudson appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Sanders, Branch 28. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.
